abstracts.cdata!:
This Results Profile focuses on Foot and
            Mouth Disease (FMD) Emergency Recovery Project in Uruguay.
            Uruguay's rural areas and overall economy were largely
            dependent on the livestock sector. The outbreak of FMD
            brought the rural areas and meat industry to a standstill,
            left an already financially embattled sector of producers
            facing increased costs, reduced revenues and uncertainty,
            and generated a major fiscal deficit. The Foot and Mouth
            Disease (FMD) Emergency Recovery Project supported a
            comprehensive set of inputs including vaccinations, training
            and awareness campaigns, and development of a tracking
            system that resulted in improved overall herd sanitary
            status and the development of modern and effective
            surveillance systems. Finally, FMD was eradicated in the
            country, rural economy was reactivated, and high quality
            beef exports were re-established. Uruguay positioned itself
            as a globally recognized model for effective food safety and
            surveillance through the establishment of their innovative
            Animal Tracking System.
